result.rationale: This species occupies a moderately small range, with the best estimates (calculated as the median of the lower [from points] and upper [from hydroBASINS] estimates) of the AOO and EOO equating to 5,814 km<sup>2</sup> and 12,413 km<sup>2</sup>, respectively. Within this small range, the species occurs in 4 threat-based locations and is undergoing a continuing decline in habitat quality as a result of ongoing threats due to land-use changes. As such, using the best estimate values of range calculations, this species is assessed as Vulnerable under criterion B1ab(iii).
result.geographicrange: This species occurs in tributaries to the lower Paraná and middle Uruguay River basins in Misiones Province, Argentina (Rodriguez and Miquelarena 2005).
result.population: There is no population documentation. Research and monitoring is needed to know the population composition, structure, size and trend.
result.habitat: It inhabits small streams with swift current, rocky and sandy bottoms (Rodriguez and Miquelarena 2005). There is no information about its ecology.
result.threats: This is a rheophilic species and the major threat is land use change for small holder agriculture, wood plantations of Eucalyptus species, and urbanization.
result.conservationmeasures: There is no research, monitoring and planning known to be conducted for this species. Research is necessary into its population, ecology, conservation and threats.
result.usetrade: It is used in the aquarium trade, as are most Rineloricaria species.
